alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Powell, Montgomery, northwestern Morgan, Bath, Menifee, Fleming, Rowan and northwestern Wolfe Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 120 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pecks Ridge to Flat Creek to near Westbend. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Owingsville, Pecks Ridge, Craintown, Stepstone, Reynoldsville, Sherburne, Peeled Oak, Howards Mill, Walkers Crossing and Lower Spencer around 125 PM EDT. Flemingsburg, Bourbon Furnace, Tilton, Craigs, Kendall Springs, Preston, Slate Valley, Crooks, Pebble and Odessa around 130 PM EDT. Marshall, Poplar Plains, Olympia, Polksville, Peasticks, Olympia Springs and Oakley around 135 PM EDT. Stanton, Jeffersonville, Salt Lick, Goddard, Bean, Hillsboro, Moore`s Ferry, Lucky Stop, Ringos Mills and Wallingford around 140 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Plummers Landing, Midland, Farmers, Young Springs, Cat Creek, Bowen, Means, Rosslyn, Cedar Groves, Ramey, Cogswell, Yale, Muses Mills, Fagan, Freestone, Bluestone, Cornwell, Lombard, Nada, Rothwell, Morehead, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Waltz, Zilpo, Haystack, Tabor, Bangor, Cranston, Brandy, Hays Crossing, Frenchburg, Wellington, Triplett, Lick Fork, Pelfrey, Craney, Paragon, Red River Gorge, Mariba and Gates. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 12 and 16, and between mile markers 22 and 38. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 107 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern and east central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Fleming; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe
